taskman.backend.task

Class TaskState

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.backend.task.TaskState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TaskStateExecuting, TaskStateFailed, TaskStateFinished, TaskStatePlanned, TaskStateUnavailable

    public abstract class TaskState
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface representing the task state. Note: We apply here the State Pattern
    Author:
    Jeroen Van Der Donckt

      • getDelay

        public long getDelay(Task t)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the delay of the given task.
        Parameters:
        t - the task to calculate the delay from
        Returns:
        the delay from the given task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the task state must be finished to calculate the delay

      • execute

        public void execute(Task task,
                    ResourceManager resourceManager,
                    java.time.LocalDateTime startTime)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Makes the task executing
        Parameters:
        task - the task to change to executing
        resourceManager - the resourceManager to check for availability
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the task is not in the correct state

      • endExecution

        public void endExecution(Task task,
                         java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                         java.time.LocalDateTime endTime,
                         java.lang.String taskStatus)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Update the state of the task to the given state.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to update the state from
        startTime - the start time of the task
        endTime - the end time of the task
        taskStatus - the new state of the task
        Postcondition:
        the state of the task is set to the given state and the time span of the task is set to a new time span created with given start and end time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the task state must be finished
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • setAlternative

        public void setAlternative(Task task,
                           Task alternative)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the alternative of the task to the given alternative.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to set the alternative from
        alternative - the alternative of the task
        Postcondition:
        the alternative of the task is set to the given alternative
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the task must be failed
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • addDependency

        public void addDependency(Task task,
                          Task dependency)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a dependency to the task.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to add the dependency to
        dependency - the dependency to add to the task
        Postcondition:
        the dependency is added to the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the task must be unavailable
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • addRequirement

        public void addRequirement(ResourceManager resourceManager,
                           Task task,
                           ResourceType resourceType,
                           int amount)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds the given requirement to the requirements of the given task.
        Parameters:
        resourceManager - the resource userManager of the system
        task - the task to add the requirement to its requirements
        resourceType - the resource type of the requirement
        amount - the amount of the requirement
        Postcondition:
        the requirement is added to the requirements of the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(ResourceManager resourceManager,
                           Task task,
                           java.time.LocalDateTime startTime)
        Returns if the planned task is available.
        Parameters:
        resourceManager - a resource userManager.
        task - a task.
        startTime - a start time.
        Returns:
        true if the planned task is available, otherwise false

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns if this task is finished.
        Returns:
        if this task is finished.

      • initializePlan

        public void initializePlan(Task task,
                           ResourceManager resourceManager,
                           java.time.LocalDateTime startTime)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Initializes a plan for this state.
        Parameters:
        task - a task.
        resourceManager - a resource userManager.
        startTime - the start time for the plan.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state is not unavailable.

      • getPlannedResources

        public java.util.List<Resource> getPlannedResources(Task task)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get the resources of the plan of a task.
        Parameters:
        task - a task.
        Returns:
        a list of resources.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state is not planned.

      • getAlternativeResources

        public java.util.List<Resource> getAlternativeResources(ResourceManager resourceManager,
                                                        Task task,
                                                        Resource resource)
                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a list of resources as alternatives for the given resource.
        Parameters:
        resourceManager - a resource userManager.
        task - a task.
        resource - a resource wrapper to search alternatives for.
        Returns:
        a list of resources as alternatives for the given resource.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state is not planned.

      • changeResource

        public void changeResource(Task task,
                           Resource oldResource,
                           Resource newResource)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Change a resource of a plan of a task.
        Parameters:
        task - a task.
        oldResource - the resource to change.
        newResource - the resource to change to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state is not planned.

        public void cancelPlan(Task task)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Cancel the plan of this task.
        Parameters:
        task - a task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state is not planned.
